    Winter Power Tips

    Stay warm, stay charged, and avoid common cold-weather pitfalls

    Winter Power Tips

    How to keep your motorhome powered and comfortable during cold-weather touring.

    üîã Battery Basics

    • Charge fully before you set off ‚Äì Cold weather drains batteries faster.
    • Check your leisure battery health ‚Äì Older batteries struggle in low temps.
    • Use hook-up when possible ‚Äì Keeps everything topped up and stress-free.
    • Solar panels still work ‚Äì But expect less output on short, cloudy days.

    üí° Tip: Turn off unused lights and devices to stretch your battery life.

    ‚ùÑÔ∏è Heating Without Panic

    • Use your onboard heating wisely ‚Äì Gas heating is great off-grid, but check your bottle levels.
    • Electric fan heaters ‚Äì Handy on hook-up, but don‚Äôt overload the circuit.
    • Thermal blinds or screens ‚Äì Keep warmth in and condensation out.
    • Hot water bottles ‚Äì Old-school, but brilliant.

    üß§ Cold-Weather Comfort

    • LED lights ‚Äì Low power draw and warm glow.
    • Charge phones during the day ‚Äì Don‚Äôt leave it to bedtime when power‚Äôs low.
    • Use a USB hub ‚Äì Efficient charging for multiple devices.
    • Keep torches handy ‚Äì Just in case.

    üß™ Practical Tips

    • Keep your water pump off overnight ‚Äì Prevents freezing and saves power.
    • Open cupboard doors ‚Äì Helps warm air circulate and prevents damp.
    • Use a moisture trap or dehumidifier ‚Äì Reduces condensation and protects electrics.
    • Check your fridge settings ‚Äì Some switch automatically between gas and electric.

    üß≠ Off-Grid Winter Checklist

    • Fully charged leisure battery
    • Full gas bottle (or two)
    • Thermal screens or blinds
    • LED lighting throughout
    • USB charging hub
    • Moisture control (traps or ventilation)
    • Warm bedding and backup heat source
